summary.para: Contains classes which implement the main functionality of the DevExpress editor controls.
Lists values that specify the type of automatic completion mode used by an editor.
When set to Default, the automatic completion mode is used.
The automatic completion feature is disabled.

When an end-user enters a character in an empty edit box for the first time, the editor automatically fills all the following placeholders with the default values. For placeholders that accept only numeric values, the ‘0’ character is the default. For placeholders that accept word characters, the “a” character is the default.

Each time an end-user types a character, the editor determines if the following placeholder can be filled automatically. If only a specific character can be inserted in this position, the editor automatically displays this character, and moves the caret to the right of this character.
Serves as the base for all editors that can be used for inplace editing in container controls.
Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

summary.para: Lists values that specify a button’s behavior.
Represents the repeat button. The event is repeatedly fired until a button is released.
Represents a simple button. The event is fired each time a button is clicked.
Represents a toggle button. Clicking a button toggles its state (pressed or released).

Enumerates error icon types.
The ‘Critical Error’ icon.
The default error icon.
The ‘Information’ icon.
Indicates that no error is associated with an editor or a cell.
Allows you to override the ErrorIndicator style to define a custom icon.
The ‘Warning’ icon.
Lists values that specify the type of mask used by an editor.
Specifies that the editor should accept date/time values, and that the mask string must use the DateTime format syntax.
The DateTime mask mode with the caret automatic movement feature.
After an end-user enters and completes a specific portion of a date/time value, the caret automatically moves to the following part of the date/time value that can be edited.
Specifies that the editor should accept numeric values, and that the mask string must use the Numeric format syntax.
Specifies that the mask should be created using the full-functional regular expressions.
Specifies that the mask should be created using the simplified regular expression syntax.
Specifies that the mask should use the simplified syntax.
Lists values that specify when data posting starts.
An action starts after a delay.
An action starts immediately.
A SpinEdit control.
Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the action that caused the editor’s validation.
The validation won’t occur.
The method was called.
An end-user has changed the edit value and pressed the ENTER key (the property should be set to true).
The editor is about to lose the focus.
The edit value has been changed by an end-user.
The editor’s value has been changed programmatically (e.g. in code behind).
Provides data for the event.
